, produced by a Gram-positive (G+) filamentous bacteria Saccharomonospora azurea, is a 36-membered marginolactone antibiotic that possesses high antimicrobial activity against frequent Gram-positive pathogens, including clinically prevalent multidrug-resistant strains (Feiszt et al. 2014).

was first described in 1954 to be produced by Streptomyces primycini, and thereafter by Micromonospora galeriensis, but none of these species was validly published (Szabó et al. 1976; Vályi-Nagy et al. 1954).

Primycin, produced by a Gram-positive (G+) filamentous bacteria
anns.postfix: , is a 36-membered marginolactone antibiotic that possesses high antimicrobial activity against frequent Gram-positive pathogens, including clinically prevalent multidrug-resistant strains (Feiszt et al. 2014).

anns.prefix: On the basis of these innovative technologies, this study reports the result of a comparative structural and functional analysis of
anns.postfix: strains in terms of primycin producing ability.

anns.prefix: Reexamination of primycin producing ability among representative species of the genus
anns.postfix: revealed that only S. azurea strains were capable of synthesizing primycin (Juhász et al. 2011), however the yield of antibiotic was significantly different according to agar well diffusion assay.

anns.prefix: Reexamination of primycin producing ability among representative species of the genus Saccharomonospora revealed that only
anns.postfix: strains were capable of synthesizing primycin (Juhász et al. 2011), however the yield of antibiotic was significantly different according to agar well diffusion assay.

anns.prefix: Comparative HPLC–DAD-ESI/MS analysis of the two primycin producer
anns.postfix: strains resulted in remarkable differences not only in yield, but also in dynamics of antibiotic production in each time points of batch fermentation.

anns.prefix: In order to assess the similarities and differences between
anns.postfix: strains in regard to their potential to produce primycin, comparative whole genome analysis was performed.

anns.prefix: Regarding quantitative differences in primycin producing ability, much effort has been made in investigating complex gene expression profiles of
anns.postfix: strains.

anns.prefix: RNA-Seq of high- and low-primycin producer
anns.postfix: strains resulted 686 DEGs with cutoff 2 and classified into diverse COGs, however metabolism-related COG categories were dominant, representing more than 50% of the total hits (Table 3S).

anns.prefix: Our results were based on the actual experimental design, in which high- and low-primycin producer
anns.postfix: strains were compared under identical culture conditions, and growth phase did not support the hypothesis that competition generally does not occur due to the time shift of the two biosynthetic process (Gago et al. 2011).

anns.prefix: The overexpression of FA synthesis related genes in low-producer
anns.postfix: strain suggests that biosynthetic activity of FA and polyketide related machinery is not a clear sequential process, rather should be considered an overlapping even at least partially.

anns.prefix: Primycin, a non-polyene marginolactone antibiotic produced by filamentous bacteria
anns.postfix: , possesses high antimicrobial activity against frequent G+ pathogens, including clinically prevalent multidrug-resistant strains (Feiszt et al. 2014).

anns.prefix: Despite the fact that the history of primycin dates back more than 60 years, there is no available scientific knowledge of the regulation of self-resistance in
anns.postfix: species.
